forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny, with a high near 53. Southwest wind 2 to 6 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely after 10pm. Mostly cloudy. Low around 47, with temperatures rising to around 49 overnight. South southwest wind 3 to 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
This morning, Downtown San Francisco awakens under a muted canopy of gray clouds, casting a gentle diffused light across the cityscape. The day feels calm and cool, with temperatures lingering in the low fifties, hinting at a softness that accompanies overcast skies. While the sun plays coy behind its curtain of clouds, there is an air of clarity, unmarred by fog, allowing the iconic outlines of the Golden Gate Bridge and the clustered silhouettes of buildings to emerge against the soft backdrop.

As the day unfolds, expect an increasingly layered atmosphere, with rain making its approach after nightfall, drawn in by a southern breeze. The chill of the evening will rise slightly, mingling with moisture as clouds thicken. It would be prudent to dress in layers today—perhaps a lightweight jacket complemented by a warm scarf, perfect for navigating both the cool air and the forthcoming dampness. Take the opportunity to stroll through local cafés, indulging in warm drinks, or explore the lesser-known narrow streets adorned with quaint shops, while savouring the intimate ambiance stirred by this dreary, yet charming day. Your pace might reflect the anticipation of rain, embodying a kind of contemplative adventure suited to this uniquely San Francisco weather.
